member.name: T:Xnope.CellsUtil
member.summary:
Utilities for RimWorld 'cells'.
Cells are generally represented as IntVec3's (3-D vectors with integer dimensions), or sometimes as LocalTargetInfo's (a struct that is castable to/from an IntVec3 or Thing).

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.Average(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Verse.IntVec3},System.Func{Verse.IntVec3,System.Int32})
member.summary: Averages an IEnumerable of cells, with an optional multiplicity function that determines how much weight a specific kind of cell should have on the average.
member.param: If not null, the result of this function is effectively the number of times the passed cell is counted in the average.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.Average(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Verse.LocalTargetInfo},System.Func{Verse.LocalTargetInfo,System.Int32})
member.summary: Averages an IEnumerable of cells, with an optional multiplicity function that determines how much weight a specific kind of cell should have on the average.
member.param: If not null, the result of this function is effectively the number of times the passed cell is counted in the average.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.Average(System.Func{Verse.LocalTargetInfo,System.Int32},Verse.LocalTargetInfo[])
member.summary: Averages the passed cells, with an optional multiplicity function that determines how much weight a specific kind of cell should have on the average.
member.param: If not null, the result of this function is effectively the number of times the passed cell is counted in the average.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.CellsInLineTo(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.IntVec3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Yields the cells in a line from a to b.
member.param: If true, will print each cell in the line to the log window.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.CornerlessEdgeCells(Verse.CellRect)
member.summary:
Yields the edges of a rect, sans corners.
Order: South-East-North-West.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.CountMineableCellsTo(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Counts the number of mineable cells between a and be.
member.param: If true, returns the highest number of consecutive mineable cells.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.DistanceSquaredToNearestMineable(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map,System.Int32,Verse.IntVec3@)
member.summary: Returns the square distance between cell and the nearest mineable cell.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.DistanceSquaredToNearestMineable(Verse.LocalTargetInfo,Verse.Map,System.Int32,Verse.LocalTargetInfo@)
member.summary:
Returns the square distance between cell and the nearest mineable cell.
The mineable out parameter is assigned a LocalTargetInfo which wraps the Thing of the cell, not merely its IntVec3.
member.param: The closest mineable cell, with a Thing instead of an IntVec3.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.FurthestCellFrom(Verse.CellRect,Verse.LocalTargetInfo,System.Boolean,System.Predicate{Verse.IntVec3})
member.summary:
Finds the furthest cell in the rect from point.
If there is no validator, only edge cells are checked, as logically only edge cells could ever be returned.
member.param: Forced to true if validator is null. Science, b*tch.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.IsAroundTerrainOfTag(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns true if the cell is around any terrain with the given tag, in the given search radius.
Example terrain tags would be "Water" or "Road".

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.IsAroundTerrainOfTag(Verse.LocalTargetInfo,Verse.Map,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns true if the cell is around any terrain with the given tag, in the given search radius.
Example terrain tags would be "Water" or "Road".

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.NearestStandableCell(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the nearest standable cell within the searchRadius, or IntVec3.Invalid if none exists.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.ToIntVec3(Verse.Rot4,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Returns the IntVec3 vector equivalent of the given rotation, optionally shifted clock-wise.
Example result: Rot4.East -> (1,0,0) || Rot4.West -> (-1,0,0)

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.ToIntVec3(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns the IntVec3 vector equivalent of the given rotation, optionally shifted clock-wise.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.TryFindNearestRoadEdgeCell(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map,Verse.IntVec3@)
member.summary: If there are road cells on the edge of map, this will return the nearest one.
member.param: Will be IntVec3.Invalid if return is false.

member.name: M:Xnope.CellsUtil.TryFindNearestRoadEdgeCells(Verse.IntVec3,Verse.Map)
member.summary: If there are road cells on the edge of the map, this returns the nearest collection of them.
